answers.answer: Dear Akhalaq,Cotton wool spots indicate lack of blood flow or ischemia to the retina.  This can result from a number of causes including hypertension [high blood pressure], diabetes, HIV, severe anemia or thrombocytopenia, hypercoagulable states, connective tissue disorders, viruses, syphilis, Behçet's and other causes.  I would recommend that you seek the care of an internist to assist in evaluating your systemic health.Dr. FeldmanSandy T. Feldman, M.D., M.S.ClearView Eye and Laser Medical CenterSan Diego, California

question: HelloIn your experience, have you ever seen idiopathic cotton wool spot(s).Can significantly high cholesterol and LDL with high normal fasting glucose cause cotton wool spot?Thanks God, Almighty that FBC, Urea, Creatinine, Sodium, Potassium, CRP, ESR were normal and HIV1 and 2 antibodies were Negative.The ? cotton wool spot disppeared after 2 weeks, but are they not usually transient?Thanks
